briefTitle: Adalimumab vs. Conventional Immunosuppression for Uveitis Trial
officialTitle: Adalimumab vs. Conventional Immunosuppression for Uveitis Trial
summary: Non-infectious intermediate, posterior, and panuveitides are chronic, potentially-blinding diseases. Vision-threatening cases require long-term therapy with oral corticosteroids and immunosuppression. Based upon preliminary data, adalimumab, a fully-human, anti-tumor necrosis(TNF)-Î± monoclonal antibody, now US FDA-approved for uveitis treatment, may be a superior corticosteroid-sparing agent than conventional immunosuppressive drugs. The ADVISE Trial is multicenter randomized, parallel-treatment, comparative effectiveness trial comparing adalimumab to conventional (small molecule) immunosuppression for corticosteroid spring in the treatment of non-infectious, intermediate, posterior, and panuveitides.

primaryOutcome.measure: Corticosteroid-sparing Treatment Success Within the First 6 Months After Randomization
